title: If no lanes are pushed, which side would win?
body: In a game of league, if no hero push a lane which side would win? Red side or blue side minion. Is leauge's lane system balanced or does 1  side have a slight advantage than the other.

replies.body:
Mide lane stays equal unless interference. 
Top lane red wins, bot lane blue wins but they both occur at roughly the same pace.
It's all about chance, sometimes the red side visits baron nashor to slay it, sometimes it is the blue side, the side of minions which go on a heroic conquest to slay the nashor generally win.

I saw a video on it recently and the answer was blue team.
There's a video series on youtube called "League of Myths" that covers all sorts of things, from Janna with Ardent censor increasing the attack speed of turrets with her shield to Quinn getting left as Valour for the whole game until she reactivates her ult.


Here's the video: http://youtu.be/WPuuRffZuao?t=1m2s

That's just in one game though, you would have to consider that, due to the targeting AI of the minions, each game would be even slightly different. Sometimes Blue minions would win, sometimes Red, it's not always going to be the same side that achieves victory.

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=xggzxlGP,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-01-22T08:24:40.976+0000)
>
> That's just in one game though, you would have to consider that, due to the targeting AI of the minions, each game would be even slightly different. Sometimes Blue minions would win, sometimes Red, it's not always going to be the same side that achieves victory.

HeartVine makes a good point. I think it would be cool if someone did a series of trials, at least 10, although that isn't a lot of trials.

I don't have the answer, but I know that one side always pushes. It seems the lane tends to push back eventually, but towers are lost. I'm not sure it happens the same way every time though. I think minion positioning comes out slightly different each time which is what leads to one side getting an advantage, without champion intervention.
